Package srg.resources

Class ResourceContainer

java.lang.Object
srg.resources.ResourceContainer
Direct Known Subclasses:
FuelContainer
public class ResourceContainer extends Object
A container which can store a certain type of resource.
Version:
1.0

  • Field Details

    • MAXIMUM_CAPACITY

      public static final int MAXIMUM_CAPACITY
      Maximum capacity for a ResourceContainer. Holds 10 items.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • ResourceContainer

      public ResourceContainer(ResourceType type, int amount) throws IllegalArgumentException
      A container filled with a consumable resource.
      Parameters:
      type - resource type
      amount - the amount of this resource in the container
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if type == FUEL and this constructor was not called from a constructor of the Fuel class.

  • Method Details

    • canStore

      public boolean canStore(ResourceType type)
      Checks if this ResourceContainer can store resources of a certain type.
      Parameters:
      type - The ResourceType to check.
      Returns:
      true if the ResourceType is not FUEL; false if the ResourceType is FUEL.

    • getAmount

      public int getAmount()
      Gets the amount of resource stored in this ResourceContainer.
      Returns:
      The amount of resource stored in this ResourceContainer.

    • setAmount

      public void setAmount(int amount)
      Parameters:
      amount - The new amount.

    • getType

      public ResourceType getType()
      Returns:
      A value from the ResourceType enum.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string of format: "ResourceType: amount"

    • getShortName

      public String getShortName()
      Returns:
      A String containing the type of this resource, based on the ResourceType enum
